preqs: One of PHS1011, PHS1080, PHS1031 or Year 12 Physics and VCE Specialist Mathematics (or equivalent) or MTH1020.Note: If you have not taken VCE Specialist Mathematics or equivalent, with permission from the School of Physics and Astronomy, you may take MTH1020 as a co-requisite.
description: This unit forms part of main-stream physics and provides foundations in rotational dynamics, the gravitational field, electrostatics, magnetism and quantum physics. Together these topics underpin interactions in our universe at sub-atomic to cosmic scales. Electrostatics explores the electric field, potential and energy for various situations, and the behaviour of capacitors and dielectrics. Magnetism covers the relation between currents, magnetic fields and induced emfs, inductance, LCR resonance, and introduces Maxwell's equations and electromagnetic waves. Quantum physics includes wave particle duality for matter and light, quantisation, wave-functions and probabilities, the Heisenberg Uncertainty Principle, hydrogen atom, and the particle-in-a-box model.
